modules.description: This module implements a WebSocket client that connects to a remote server using a provided network flow. It handles WebSocket handshake negotiation, message framing, and connection lifecycle management. Concrete use cases include establishing secure bidirectional communication with a WebSocket server for real-time data exchange, such as chat applications or live updates.

Handles WebSocket connections over MirageOS-compatible sockets. Accepts configuration and error handling parameters, then creates a connection handler that processes incoming WebSocket data using provided input handlers. Designed for building MirageOS-based servers that communicate via WebSockets.

This module enables WebSocket communication in MirageOS applications, managing connection setup, message framing, and bidirectional data transfer over asynchronous network flows. It integrates client and server implementations that support secure, type-safe real-time interactions, such as chat services or live data feeds, using Lwt for concurrency. The client submodule establishes and maintains WebSocket connections with remote endpoints, while the server submodule handles incoming connections and routes messages through customizable handlers. Together, they provide a complete stack for developing MirageOS-based WebSocket services that run on Unix or Xen platforms.
